description.en: Learn to use 'ever' in negative sentences (meaning 'never') and in questions (meaning 'ever/at any time'). Master the placement after auxiliaries.
description.es: Aprende a usar 'ever' en frases negativas (significando 'nunca') y en preguntas (significando 'alguna vez'). Domina la colocación después de auxiliares.

prompt.en: I don't ever remember promising that!

exercises.solution: I don't ever remember promising that!

tip.en: In negative sentences, 'ever' means 'never'. Place it after the auxiliary and 'not': don't/won't/aren't + ever. This is more emphatic than just 'never'.
tip.es: En frases negativas, 'ever' significa 'nunca'. Colócalo después del auxiliar y 'not': don't/won't/aren't + ever. Es más enfático que solo 'never'.

prompt.en: He doesn't ever speak.

exercises.solution: He doesn't ever speak.

tip.en: In negative sentences, 'ever' means 'never'. Place it after the auxiliary and 'not': don't/won't/aren't + ever. This is more emphatic than just 'never'.
tip.es: En frases negativas, 'ever' significa 'nunca'. Colócalo después del auxiliar y 'not': don't/won't/aren't + ever. Es más enfático que solo 'never'.

prompt.en: Do you ever speak to your friends in Canada?
prompt.es: ¿Hablas alguna vez con tus amigos en Canadá?

exercises.solution: Do you ever speak to your friends in Canada?

tip.en: In questions, 'ever' means 'at any time/alguna vez'. Place it after the auxiliary and subject: Do/Have/Are + you + ever. It asks about any occasion in life.
tip.es: En preguntas, 'ever' significa 'alguna vez'. Colócalo después del auxiliar y sujeto: Do/Have/Are + you + ever. Pregunta sobre cualquier ocasión en la vida.
